title: Formula for the the Angular Momentum
text: Use the same angular momentum formula $$L=I \omega$$ to get angular momentum of Earth on its axis.

title: Calculate the Moment of Inertia of Earth
text: The Earth can be approximated as a solid sphere, so its moment of inertia (I) is given by: $$I=\frac{2}{5} m r^2$$ where $$m$$ is the mass of the Earth, approximately 5.97×10**24 kg, $$r$$ is the radius of the Earth, approximately 6.378×10**6 $$m$$. What is I?

title: Find the Angular Velocity of Earth in $$\frac{rad}{s}$$
text: The Earth completes one rotation every $$24$$ hours (86400 seconds), so the angular velocity $$ω=\frac{2\pi}{T}=\frac{2\pi}{86400}=$$?

title: Calculate the Angular Momentum
text: Now, substitute the values of I and ω to find the angular momentum $$L=I \omega$$ in $$\frac{kg m^2}{s}$$.
